panels.description: The Hyper-V Virtual Machine Management Service (`vmms`) is required to be running in order to perform actions such as `Get-VM` or use a virtual console. Also features such as `Live Migration will be unavailable.

targets.query: SELECT last("state") FROM "win_services" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$server$/) AND "display_name"::tag = 'Hyper-V Virtual Machine Management') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: vmms service - current

panels.description: This is the `Computed Time Offset` from UTC. A value of up to `120` seconds is fine for most workloads. If the value goes above `300` (5 minute skew) then kerberos authentication will not function.
panels.title: Diff to UTC (in Seconds)

targets.query: SELECT mean("Handle_Count") FROM "win_process_v2" WHERE host =~ /$server/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)

panels.description: This is the total count of Hyper-V Virtual Machines on this host. This metric is gathered from the `Partitions` count on this host.
panels.title: virtual machines
memory available for new virtual machines

result.text: Free space for C:\ is Okay

targets.query: SELECT mean("Handle_Count") FROM "win_process_v2" WHERE host =~ /$server/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)
SELECT last("load5") FROM "system" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$server$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)
SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean(reads),1s) as "read" FROM "diskio" WHERE "host" =~ /$server$/ AND "name" =~ /$disk$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), *
SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean(writes),1s) as "write" FROM "diskio" WHERE "host" =~ /$server$/ AND "name" =~ /$disk$/  AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), *
SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean(read_bytes),1s) as "read" FROM "diskio" WHERE "host" =~ /$server$/ AND "name" =~ /$disk$/  AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), *
SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean(write_bytes),1s) as "write" FROM "diskio" WHERE "host" =~ /$server$/ AND "name" =~ /$disk$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), *
SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean(read_time),1s) as "read" FROM "diskio" WHERE "host" =~ /$server$/ AND "name" =~ /$disk$/  AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), *
SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean(write_time),1s) as "write" FROM "diskio" WHERE "host" =~ /$server$/ AND "name" =~ /$disk$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), *

panels.title: vmnet bytes sent / rec per sec

list.label: Server
list.name: server
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM system WITH KEY=host

list.label: Mountpoint
list.name: mountpoint
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "disk" WITH KEY = "path" WHERE host =~ /$server/

list.label: CPU
list.name: cpu
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "cpu" WITH KEY = "cpu" WHERE host =~ /$server/

list.label: Disk
list.name: disk
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "diskio" WITH KEY = "name" WHERE host =~ /$server/

list.label: Network interface
list.name: netif
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "net" WITH KEY = "interface" WHERE host =~ /$server/
